text:
apachetest::makeconf (from test/apachetest/apachetest.tcl uses the id command to extract user and group for the Apache config file.

Solaris has a different output, so it doesn't properly match resulting in an invalid configuration file. This could be solved by changing 

  set group  [lindex [regexp -inline {(groups=)([\d]+)(\()([^\)]+)(\))} $raw_string]  4]

to 

  set group  [lindex [regexp -inline {(gid=)([\d]+)(\()([^\)]+)(\))} $raw_string]  4]

which I think would also work on all other (*nix) platforms (at least it does so on my CentOS and OSX machines)

However, instead of doing this, I'd opt for removing the User and Group directives from the config file altogether, as this would remove the dependency to the external id command and therefore also simplifies a Windows port.

(Apache will not run as anybody else than the current user anyway, so setting an explicit User and Group does not change anything.)
